DataElement.preferredName: Engraftment Syndrome Skin Rash Body Surface Area Present Percentage Integer::0 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place numeric value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of the percentage of body surface area affected by skin rash due to engraftment syndrome.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Engraftment Syndrome Skin Rash Body Surface Area Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the involved body surface area,  the measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface, of a skin rash, any change in color or texture of the skin, being present as evidence of engraftment syndrome, a toxicity of hematopoietic stem cell transplantation that manifests as fever, rash and pulmonary deterioration which becomes evident at marrow engraftment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
A toxicity of hematopoietic stem cell transplantation
that manifests as fever, rash and pulmonary deterioration which becomes
evident at marrow engraftment. It occurs unexpectedly and is
occasionally fatal. It can occur after an autogeneic or an allogeneic
hematopoietic cell transplantation.

Concepts.definition: A toxicity of hematopoietic stem cell transplantation that manifests as fever, rash and pulmonary deterioration which becomes evident at marrow engraftment. It occurs unexpectedly and is occasionally fatal. It can occur after an autogeneic or an allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:A measure of the 2-dimensional exent of the body surface.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Any change in the skin which affects its appearance or texture. A rash may be localized to one part of the body, or affect all the skin. Rashes may cause the skin to change color, itch, become warm, bumpy, dry, cracked or blistered, swell and may be painful.

A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Body Surface Area Percentage Integer::0 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing._A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Body Surface Area Percentage Integer::0 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin). Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight. BSA is often an important factor in dosing.:Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A number with no fractional part.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:3061213
ReferenceDocuments.description: AdverseEvent > PerformedObservation > AssessedResultRelationshp > PerformedMedicalConditionResult [engraftment syndrome] > PerformedObservation > AssessedResultRelationship > PerformedMedicalCondition.value [skin rash] WHERE PerformedMedicalConditionResult.value [engraftment syndrome] = "engraftment syndrome" AND PerformedMedicalConditionResult.value [skin rash] > PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = "Determine percentage of body surface area affected by skin rash"
